New Records: Francisco Lindor hit a grand slam in the sixth inning, scoring four runs and helping the Mets win Game 4 of the NLDS
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a go-ahead grand slam in the sixth inning
Edwin Diaz struck out Kyle Schwarber for the final out in the ninth inning
Fireworks detonated above the ballpark after the Mets' win
The Mets celebrated their first home clincher in Citi Field's 16 seasons of existence
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets needed a victory on the final day of the regular season just to reach the playoffs
The team followed with two victories in three games to win the NL Wild Card Series in Milwaukee
Post-Match Reflections: Francisco Lindor said 'I want to win it all, and ours will be a team that will forever be remembered'
Team owner Steve Cohen said 'That 341 is looking pretty freakin' good right now' referring to Lindor's $341 million contract
Manager Carlos Mendoza said 'This is a first-class organization, we've got great people here. I'm proud of the fan base. Mets Nation, this is for you.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets will face either the Padres or Dodgers beginning Sunday in Game 1 of the NLCS
The Padres started the night with a 2-1 lead in their best-of-five series against the Dodgers
The game was played at Citi Field in front of a sellout crowd
Others: Jose Quintana started the game and allowed only two hits and two walks over five innings
Reed Garrett, David Peterson, and Edwin Diaz combined on four scoreless innings in relief
